body.p:
To his Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlette
Govenor of Kentucky

Your petitioner Mary Green would respectfully state that she was indicted by a Grand Jury in the Louisville City Court for Keeping a disorderly house. The Jury that tried the case imposed a fine of four hundred dollars $400.
It was proven on the trial that petitioner kept a house of prostitution, & That at the common law constituting a disorderly house, The verdict was rendered on the evidence alone.

p.note: Judgment for $400 at the September Term of the Louisville City Court

body.p: Your petitioner is a poor woman & unable to pay any part of the fine, & if not relieved by your Excellency, imprisonment in the city work house will be the result.

Your Excellency is respectfully refered to the Signers who unite in the prayer for a remission of the fine
Your petitioner prays your Excellency to remit the fine

Louisville City Ct
vs
Mary Green
$400,
Remit except $80 & fees & costs
16 Sept /65
